intro: Spigelia linarioides, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from white to red. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Spigelia linarioides thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value and unique floral structure make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
